Right and in NY they are absolutely wrong for calling it that. They want to scare people by using the word assault rifle.

But it does have a technical meaning, it's not semantics.
An assault rifle is a selective-fire rifle that uses an intermediate cartridge and a detachable magazine
That's from Wikipedia and there Are a couple sources to go along with it. Keyword here is 'selective-fire' meaning you can switch from semi-automatic to full auto.

No I don't mind explaining things to people that have never been familiar with something that I know about. Well, this is another example of uninformed people making laws. In NY and some other northern states you cannot have more than 2 of these specific criteria they made up. If it has a magazine it can't have a telescoping stock, grenade launcher attachment (idk why this is even a thing), a threaded barrel, and I think there's one more. NONE of these make a rifle an assault rifle. As I said before an assault rifle can be switched from semiautomatic to fully automatic. They just call them assault rifles to push their agenda and because assault rifles sound scarier than semi-automatic rifles.

We call semi-automatic AR-15's assault rifles
This is the problem. They are not assault rifles, and no AR doesn't stand for 'Assault Rifle' it stands for 'Armalite Rifle' the original creators of the rifle. This is why pro second amendment people get upset because people mislabel and jump to these conclusions all of the time and especially that congress and lawmakers aren't educated with guns and they are the ones making the laws. Also, no semi-automatic rifles are not assault rifles. By definition assault rifles can be switched from single-fire to automatic fire (only military weapons have this ability). So when the article states that Amazon delivered an assault rifle... It makes me think they delivered a fully automatic military grade M16, which would be a much much bigger issue than the semi-automatic rifle. That would be like Amazon delivering Advil and the article stated they sent OxyContin.
But it does matter. There's a difference in them delivering a regular rifle and a highly illegal assault rifle.

Here's a list of 557 bills proposed by the house republicans. Not all of these have been voted on yet, but the ones passed in December:
gt;Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016
gt;To amend the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994, to reauthorize the Missing Alzheimers Disease and Patient Alert Program, and to promote initiatives that will reduce the risk of injury and death relating to the wandering characteristic
